ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Many fundamental concepts concerning enzymatic rates, conformational changes, and enzyme mechanisms.
A more physical chem approach to biochem, thinking about reaction kinetics, nmr

I think the course was well designed and really highlighted a lot of key concepts protein dynamics and kinetics. I think from an organic student perspective I would have liked to see some more of the reaction mechanisms because biomemtic sequences are important in synthesis strategy, but I understand that it was also the case where a good number of organic students just ended up in the class because it was the only biochemistry class we could take in the first year with the chemical biology class matching organometallics and special topis requiring the chemical biology class.
More insight into the thermodynamic, kinetic, and chemical parameters that account for enzyme catalytic efficiency.
I learned a lot of current techniques in studying enzymes and in evaluating current research.
a broad introduction of various enzyme types. More importantly, the class taught me how to analyze kinetics data and come up with an appropriate conclusion.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I believe I touched on this above where I think I would have liked to see some more of the actual enzyme mechanisms when discussing different systems. I think the class was well organized though through the student talks, and I know that my student talk really pushed me to dig a little deeper into the papers than I was when preparing for class

I enjoyed working through the historical chronologies of much of the subject matter, and how the fields developed. However, some of the topics (such as kinetic isotope effects) were covered in great detail, while other topics were given only a cursory treatment. Strive for more balance in coverage of topics.

I like the focus on primary literature, and the format of the exams. I especially liked the presentations as it gave me a chance to read and really think about a paper on a topic I was not comfortable with.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, great class for understanding the base of enzyme reactions and kinetics.
Yes it was enjoyable and interesting
I think it is definitely a good course for the right audience and overall interesting
Yes, I think the skills in data analysis that this class focuses on is valuable.
